page.title: 07TRESWELL CHURCH
page.content: We attend our church every Sunday morning at 11.00 o'clock and take part in the service. Usually we arrive early to hand out Hymnbooks and sometimes we ring the bells. As we enter the graveyard we look at the old tombstones. The font is over five hundred years old and there is also a rare Vinegar Bible. The Communion cup was made in the reign of Queen Elizabeth 1st, and it is of solid silver. Local children go to church because they get a lot of enjoyment out of the service and it is a way in which they can serve and be a part of the community.
